definition: to stand/to have a footing/to be established/to base oneself on
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately

sentences.english: But Netease still cannot anticipate in the base oneself upon of enterprise mailbox market and development.
sentences.chinese: 但網易在企業郵箱市場的立足與發展仍然不可預期。

sentences.english: To make matters worse, Mr Berntsen Larsen quickly threw up after entering the tank, which was standing room only.
sentences.chinese: 更糟的是，他一進入僅有立足之地的馬桶就吐了。

sentences.english: We have to base itself, potential, and strengthen the goal, and strive to become.
sentences.chinese: 我們要立足自身，挖掘潛力，強化目標，力求成才。

sentences.english: I sink in deep mire, where there is no foothold.
sentences.chinese: 我身陷泥潭中，找不到立足點。

sentences.english: Fourthly, it finds solution to the centurial problem.
sentences.chinese: 它找到了破解世紀難題的立足點。

sentences.english: China's energy development is based on the principle of relying on domestic resources.
sentences.chinese: 中國能源發展堅持立足國內的基本方針。

sentences.english: It is also encouraging the purchase and consumption of local produce, communicating its long-term benefits.
sentences.chinese: 從長遠的利益考慮，鼓勵自產自銷是基本立足點。

sentences.english: Bonovo is a China-based company with a 17 year history as a pioneer in the Chinese orthopedic industry.
sentences.chinese: 博能華立足中國，擁有17年領先的骨科行業歷史。

sentences.english: The mountain climber could not find many footholds on the melting ice.
sentences.chinese: 登山者在融化的冰上找不到多少立足之處。

sentences.english: This method is so anchored in the context of construction that it seems difficult to change.
sentences.chinese: 這種方法是立足於建設的背景下，這似乎很難改變。

sentences.english: It was difficult to get even a toehold in the kitchen dinnerware market.
sentences.chinese: 在廚房餐具市場立足甚至佔有一席之位是很難。

sentences.english: If you doubt yourself, then indeed you stand on shaky ground。(Ibsen, Norwegian dramatist)
sentences.chinese: 如果你懷疑自己，那麼你的立足點確實不穩固了。

sentences.english: The original school was based in Epicurus ' home and garden.
sentences.chinese: 最初的學校立足於伊壁鳩魯的家和花園。

sentences.english: Pure Stannum Mill" comes from Malaysia, and is established in China."
sentences.chinese: 純錫坊”源自馬來西亞，立足於中國。

sentences.english: KETUT: Keep grounded so it's like you have four legs, that way you can stay in this world.
sentences.chinese: 你要像四隻腳著地，這樣你能在這個世界立足。

sentences.english: It’s an evidence-based approach rather than a faith-based one.
sentences.chinese: 這是個立足於證據而非立足於信仰的方法。

definition: to stand firmly/to gain a foothold/to establish oneself
settle down and get on with one's pursuit
to put effort into sth/to try really hard
to break new ground (for agriculture)/to open up (a new seam)/to develop (border regions)/fig. to open up (new horizons)
to gain a firm foothold/(fig.) to get oneself established
to borrow sb's authority/to seize an opportunity
to lay (a foundation)/to conquer (a city etc)/to shoot down (a bird etc)
